Starpackage v0.1.0 Manual

Name

Starpackage — Build standalone executables from Tcl source files.

Synopsis

starpackage command arguments

Description

Starpacks are bundled Tcl applications that include a runtime, dependencies, and source code. The purpose of Starpackage is to provide a high-level API that abstracts the building of Starpacks into a few core commands:

  • demo

    Initialize an example project and make Starpacks of it.

  • init name

    Initialize a basic project called name. This will produce the virtual filesystem directory and populate it with skeleton files ready to be modified.

  • build names

    Bundle any number of projects into Starpacks for various platforms and architectures. Will create a bin/ directory if one does not already exist and put Starpacks there.

Examples

$ starpackage demo
$ exa --tree
.
├── bin
│  ├── demo-linux-i686.kit
│  └── demo-linux-x86_64.kit
├── demo.vfs
│  ├── lib
│  └── main.tcl
└── lib
   ├── runtimes
   │  ├── linux-i686.kit
   │  └── linux-x86_64.kit
   ├── sdx.kit
   └── tclkit-8.6.3-linux-x86_64

See Also
